channel.title: Password Protect
channel.description:
I was wondering if anyone knew how to make a html code or javascript code that i can add to my website to make it so that you need a password and username to view the webpage.
If anyone would could help i would greatly appreciate it

item.title: Password Protect
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:24, topic:313480”][quote author=inertia link=topic=409980.msg3026649#msg3026649 date=1257979963]
If cookies are not available, other methods of identification are automatically used like useragent+ip or other semi-unique browser headers.
[/quote]
Really? Could you find some documentation of this? iirc the php.ini directive to use nothing but cookies for sessions has been on by default since 5.3. The only other method I was aware of was passing the SID as a GET parameter, which is generally considered insecure and a bad practice.[/quote]

I was getting confused with an article I read on securing sessions a while back and for some reason applied it to something I did not quite understand - When I run a simple file downloader which does not use cookies, it somehow stores the sessions for it. This is after closing and reopening the program so there is definitely no client-side SID stored. My guess was that the server stored header info about the client and related it to their SID.

I’ll try to find somewhere that explains why this happens…

Read full topic

item.title: Password Protect
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

inertia:

If cookies are not available, other methods of identification are automatically used like useragent+ip or other semi-unique browser headers.

Really? Could you find some documentation of this? iirc the php.ini directive to use nothing but cookies for sessions has been on by default since 5.3. The only other method I was aware of was passing the SID as a GET parameter, which is generally considered insecure and a bad practice.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Protect
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:20, topic:313480”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=409980.msg3026129#msg3026129 date=1257945806]
IIRC, sessions in PHP are stored server side, not set as client cookies.
[/quote]

A visitor accessing your web site is assigned a unique id, the so-called session id. This is either stored in a cookie on the user side or is propagated in the URL.

Yes, the session data itself is stored on the server and is referenced by the user’s session id, which is most commonly stored in a cookie.[/quote]

If cookies are not available, other methods of identification are automatically used like useragent+ip or other semi-unique browser headers.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Protect
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

eczema3:

IIRC, sessions in PHP are stored server side, not set as client cookies.

PHP Documentation:

A visitor accessing your web site is assigned a unique id, the so-called session id. This is either stored in a cookie on the user side or is propagated in the URL.

Yes, the session data itself is stored on the server and is referenced by the user’s session id, which is most commonly stored in a cookie.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Protect
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

okay done the usernames and passwords but i still dont know how i am going to make it so if someone tries to get into my pages without logging in then they cant access because my pages are html and the login and logout thing is php[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 11, 2009, 02:43:35 am[/size][hr]okay ill try that[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 11, 2009, 02:54:19 am[/size][hr]For some reason the login is successful but sometimes i have to refresh the page for it come properly connect, you know how to fix that?
it comes up with a white background

thanks for your time

Read full topic

item.title: Password Protect
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

TabbyKiller:

But my home is a html document

Change it to a php file (just change the extension).

TabbyKiller:

if i make these folders will it still work?

No

TabbyKiller:

How do i set the usernames because i tried but it still says wrong username or password

The bit where it says username1 and password1 are the username and password.
so if i wanted a user with the username admin and the password my_awesome_password and another with the username admin2 and the password my_second_awesome_password, i would change the code to.

$users = array( array('username'=>'admin', 'password'=>'my_awesome_password'), array('username'=>'admin2', 'password'=>'my_second_awesome_password') );

if you don’t use the other usernames just delete them.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Protect
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

index.php

[code]<?php
session_start();

if ( !isset($_SESSION[‘username’]) ) {
//header(‘Location: login.php’);
echo ‘Please login to see this page.’;
exit;
}

echo ‘You are logged in as ‘.$_SESSION[‘username’].’. Logout’;

?>[/code]

login.php

[code]<?php
session_start();

if ( isset($_SESSION[‘username’]) ) {
header(‘Location: index.php’);
exit;
}

$users = array(
array(‘username’=>‘username1’, ‘password’=>‘password1’),
array(‘username’=>‘username2’, ‘password’=>‘password2’),
array(‘username’=>‘username3’, ‘password’=>‘password3’)
);

if ( isset($_POST[‘username’], $_POST[‘password’]) ) {

$logged_in = false;

foreach ($users as $user) {
	if ( ($_POST['username'] == $user['username']) && ($_POST['password'] == $user['password']) ) {
		echo 'Username and password correct.<br>';
		echo 'Click <a href="index.php">here</a> to go to index.php';
		$_SESSION['username'] = $user['username'];
		$logged_in = true;
	}
}

if ($logged_in !== true) {
	echo 'Wrong username or password.';
}

} else {
echo ’

Username:

Password:



';
}
?>[/code]

logout.php

<?php session_start(); $_SESSION = array(); header('Location: index.php'); ?>

meh…modify it as you wish

Read full topic

item.title: Password Protect
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

i tried htaccess but does it need to have a . in front of it? Because the webhost im using doesn’t allow . as a name starter

Moparisthebest:

You could use my agreement.php and modify it to not set the cookie if the username and password were not correct. You would want to change the cookie contents too and verify that every time the website was visited as well.

Yes please. that would be nice
